title: wishlist: aggregate errors in reports?
body:
version 0.5.1.dev304 which is #1502 I believe atm

if I do smth like
```
hopa:/tmp/datasets.datalad.org/labs/haxby/raiders
$> datalad --on-failure=continue get */anatomy/
```
which would fail on 110 files (but that is ok -- I do expect that some files would fail), my screen is flooded with identical error messages, then equal number of WARNINGS, and then one HUGE ERROR aggregating all of them, probably to complete the assault on my visual system so I couldn't even scroll back to regain some memory of the past.

I really love that now we can see those messages from annex about where file might be available from, but IMHO we should add some smartness to it -- we should try to avoid flooding the screen.  E.g. may be we need group errors having the same content and state that "X" failed with error msg "blah"?   Error message with  ` Command did not complete successfully ` dump should also become human friendly and limit amount of output.  It is after all just a log message and we have "proper" return values now happen someone really need to analyze what is going on.
